author: bergmeister
body:
This issue shows a regression as it works in `Windows PowerShell` but not `PowerShell Core`.
When `Import-LocalizedData` is used without specifying the `UICulture` explicitly but there is no language folder for it, then Windows PowerShell falls back to one that is available but PowerShell Core (6.1 and 6.1-preview) does not assign any variables and there is also no error/warning.

Steps to reproduce
------------------

I made an example hello-world repo [here](https://github.com/bergmeister/PSCore_Import-LocalizedData_Bug) for your convenience

Expected behaviour
-----------------

`Import-LocalizedData` could e.g.

- fallback to an existing culture if there is no exact match
- offer a parameter for a default culture if there is no match
- log a warning instead of not doing anything

Actual behavior
---------------

The variable will not be bound if there is a mismatch and no warnings are given to the user, thus leading to bugs.
Yes, the module author could fix this, by writing some logic for a fallback language provider if there is no match but given that Windows PowerShell handled it nicely, this is a bit of a regression to me.

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.2.0-preview.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.2.0-preview.1
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17134
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

```
title: Import-LocalizedData does not load any data when there is mismatch between current UI culture and data available
